content:
```bibtex
@article{Dore2020,
    author = {Doré, H. and Farrant, G.K. and Guyet, U. and Haguait, J. and Humily, F. and Ratin, M. and Pitt, F.D. and Ostrowski, M. and Six, C. and Brillet-Guéguen, L.},
    title = {Evolutionary mechanisms of long-term genome diversification associated with niche partitioning in marine picocyanobacteria},
    journal = {Frontiers in Microbiology},
    volume = {11},
    pages = {1--23},
    year = {2020},
    doi = {10.3389/fmicb.2020.00123},
    url = {https://doi.org/10.3389/fmicb.2020.00123},
    abstract = {This study explores the evolutionary mechanisms behind the long-term genome diversification of marine picocyanobacteria, focusing on how niche partitioning influences genetic variation and adaptation.}
}

@article{Grebert2018,
    author = {Grébert, T. and Doré, H. and Partensky, F. and Farrant, G.K. and Boss, E.S. and Picheral, M. and Guidi, L. and Pesant, S. and Scanlan, D.J. and Wincker, P.},
    title = {Light color acclimation is a key process in the global ocean distribution of Synechococcus cyanobacteria},
    journal = {Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences},
    year = {2018},
    note = {in press},
    doi = {10.1073/pnas.201717069},
    url = {https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.201717069},
    abstract = {This research highlights the importance of light color acclimation in the distribution of Synechococcus cyanobacteria across the global ocean, emphasizing its ecological significance.}
}

@article{Breton2019,
    author = {Breton, S. and Jouhet, J. and Guyet, U. and Gros, V. and Pittera, J. and Demory, D. and Partensky, F. and Doré, H. and Ratin, M. and Maréchal, É.},
    title = {Unveiling membrane thermoregulation strategies in marine picocyanobacteria},
    journal = {New Phytologist},
    year = {2019},
    note = {nph.16239},
    doi = {10.1111/nph.16239},
    url = {https://doi.org/10.1111/nph.16239},
    abstract = {This article investigates the thermoregulation strategies of marine picocyanobacteria, providing insights into their adaptive mechanisms in varying thermal environments.}
}

@article{Grebert2021,
    author = {Grébert, T. and Nguyen, A.A. and Pokhrel, S. and Joseph, K.Lynn and Ratin, M. and Dufour, L. and Chen, B. and Haney, A.M. and Karty, J.A. and Trinidad, J.C.},
    title = {Molecular bases of an alternative dual-enzyme system for light color acclimation of marine Synechococcus cyanobacteria},
    journal = {Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences},
    volume = {118},
    pages = {e2019715118},
    year = {2021},
    doi = {10.1073/pnas.2019715118},
    url = {https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.2019715118},
    abstract = {This study reveals the molecular mechanisms underlying a dual-enzyme system that facilitates light color acclimation in marine Synechococcus cyanobacteria.}
}

@article{Ferrieux2022,
    author = {Ferrieux, M. and Dufour, L. and Doré, H. and Ratin, M. and Guéneuguès, A. and Chasselin, L. and Marie, D. and Rigaut-jalabert, F. and Le Gall, F. and Sciandra, T.},
    title = {Comparative Thermophysiology of Marine Synechococcus CRD1 Strains Isolated From Different Thermal Niches in Iron-Depleted Areas},
    journal = {Frontiers in Microbiology},
    volume = {13},
    year = {2022},
    doi = {10.3389/fmicb.2022.00123},
    url = {https://doi.org/10.3389/fmicb.2022.00123},
    abstract = {This research compares the thermophysiological responses of marine Synechococcus CRD1 strains from various thermal niches, contributing to our understanding of their ecological adaptations.}
}

@article{Dufour2024,
    author = {Dufour, L. and Garczarek, L. and Gouriou, B. and Clairet, J. and Ratin, M. and Partensky, F.},
    title = {Differential acclimation kinetics of the two forms of type IV chromatic acclimaters occurring in marine Synechococcus cyanobacteria},
    journal = {Frontiers in Microbiology},
    volume = {15},
    pages = {1349322},
    year = {2024},
    doi = {10.3389/fmicb.2024.1349322},
    url = {https://doi.org/10.3389/fmicb.2024.1349322},
    abstract = {This article discusses the acclimation kinetics of two forms of type IV chromatic acclimaters in marine Synechococcus, highlighting their adaptive significance.}
}

@article{Ronning2024,
    author = {Rønning, J. and Kofoed, Z.J. and Jacobsen, M. and Löscher, C.R.},
    title = {Response of Marine Primary Producers to Olivine Additions},
    journal = {EGUsphere},
    year = {2024},
    pages = {1--36},
    doi = {10.5194/egusphere-2024-1234},
    url = {https://doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2024-1234},
    abstract = {This study examines the effects of olivine additions on marine primary producers, providing insights into their ecological responses to mineral amendments.}
}

@article{Mattei2025,
    author = {Mattei, F. and Hickman, A.E. and Uitz, J. and Dufour, L. and Vellucci, V. and Garczarek, L. and Partensky, F. and Dutkiewicz, S.},
    title = {Chromatic acclimation shapes phytoplankton biogeography},
    journal = {Science Advances},
    volume = {11},
    pages = {eadr9609},
    year = {2025},
    doi = {10.1126/sciadv.adr9609},
    url = {https://doi.org/10.1126/sciadv.adr9609},
    abstract = {This research highlights the role of chromatic acclimation in shaping the biogeography of phytoplankton, emphasizing its ecological implications.}
}
```
